benchmark_details.name: LANID (LLM-Assisted New Intent Discovery)
benchmark_details.overview: LANID is a framework designed to tackle the challenge of novel intent discovery in Task-Oriented Dialogue Systems by leveraging Large Language Models to enhance lightweight encoders through contrastive learning.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enable systems to autonomously identify novel intents while maintaining robust performance on known ones.

data.source: The BANKING dataset, StackOverflow dataset, and M-CID dataset were used for evaluation.
data.size: 13,083 utterances for BANKING dataset, 20,000 queries for StackOverflow dataset, 1,745 utterances for M-CID dataset
data.annotation: The datasets are used with and without labels in both unsupervised and semi-supervised settings.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on clustering results comparing predicted clusters with true intent labels.
methodology.interpretation: Higher NMI, ARI, and ACC values indicate better clustering performance and model efficacy.
methodology.baseline_results: LANID surpassed strong baselines in both unsupervised and semi-supervised settings.
methodology.validation: Evaluation was conducted with three benchmark datasets.
